name: Quinoa Stuffing
author: Heather Hogan
summary: Quinoa is a fluffy, slightly crunchy, high-protein, gluten-free alternative grain native to South America. This can be used to stuff a turkey or served as a side dish.
ingredients: 1  butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and diced
directions: Bring vegetable stock to a boil in a saucepan, reduce heat to low, and stir in quinoa
Cover pan and simmer until quinoa absorbs the liquid, 10 to 15 minutes
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Cook and stir butternut squash and zucchinis in the hot oil until slightly browned, about 10 minutes
Stir quinoa into the vegetables and gently mix green onions, apricots, cranberries, and parsley into the stuffing
Drizzle with lime juice to taste
